Articles.Content:
Hello all, Max of MAX AEROSPACE here with a surprisingly practical design. We saw great potential in the new nuclear engine, so we just sort of shoe-horned it into a regular rocket and by golly it worked!

Here is an album of a mission to Duna in a slightly modified version:

http://imgur.com/a/hftRL#0

We have more pictures as well as a detailed account of a botched mission to Jool here:

http://imgur.com/a/qYxbK#0

This rocket is a great option for lower end computers, and is the favorite on my laptop.

Edited September 22, 2012 by Maxed-Rockets
:-O Excellent idea!Thank you so much for this! (talking about aerospike on decoupler on nerva)
??? So small craft and it can reach Jool?!

??? So small craft and it can reach Jool?!

Reach Jool and land on a moon. Return not guaranteed. Or expected.

I accidentally missed my phase angle by about 5 degrees, so I wasted a lot of fuel getting back.

Quick update, I have successfully landed on Duna with this!

http://imgur.com/a/hftRL#0

Quick update, I have successfully landed on Duna with this!

http://imgur.com/a/hftRL#0

Good one! Thumbs op :-)
Neat, finally a reasonable sized ship that can reach a planet like jool and land on its moon.

we need more designers like you

I originally used the engine on decoupler trick for a spaceplane, but I used a jet engine then.

I am almost annoyed that this design that I built to test the properties of the nuke engine works better then any purpose designed ship I have made so far.
